pages.text: This "crying obsidian" material piques my interest. So far, the "tears" it creates have soaked into other materials in a matter of seconds.$(br2)...if only enough of them can be contained for a detailed study.

Perhaps... trying to hold it in a noble metal? Something like silver, that shouldn't be too hard to test.$(br2)This doesn't sound completely unreasonable. I should try making something like a "cauldron"...

If the silver will actually be able to contain the tears, it opens so many possibilities for experiments on this... "substance"...$(br2)Random rocks were able to absorb tears without any noticeable change, but could mundane metals do the same if completely submerged? Unlikely.
